intro: Paradisanthus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered paradise plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its aesthetic appeal.
